instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2565: What is 820-2565? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.ADPATER_SENSE: What is ADPATER_SENSE? This is a typo of ADAPTER_SENSE When you see ADPATER_SENSE, assume they meant to type ADAPTER_SENSE.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> led green not always
threads.message:
Hi,
it's difficult to have the green led on this board (is very low light green) sometimes work.
the board work with an full charge battery, the battery indicator working, no liquid, i try new magsafe board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2565</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, same issue.
when i have not green led:
PPBUS 12,14V
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> = 3,491V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>=3,49v
<SIGNAL>SMC_AOK</SIGNAL>=3,31V
I use an original charger

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> led green not always
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> led green not always
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> led green not always
threads.message: Voltage on <CAPACITOR>C7005</CAPACITOR>? Check resistance between pins 17/18, 27/28 of the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> led green not always
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C7005</CAPACITOR> move between 2,4V and 2,6V
17/18 = 3ohm
27/28 = 20ohm
I found the problem, i change <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> 10kohm instead of 20ohm, now the green led work.
thanks for your help
